description: The transaction was successfully authenticated and authorized by the Issuer Bank.
system_behavior: The card details, PIN/OTP were verified, and the account had sufficient balance. The Issuer approved the debit.

description: The transaction was declined because the account balance is lower than the transaction amount.
system_behavior: The Issuer Bank checked the account ledger and determined the available balance was insufficient to cover the purchase or withdrawal.
agent_message: “The transaction was declined due to insufficient funds. Please check your account balance.”

user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “The bank's records show the balance is lower than the requested amount. Please check your balance via SMS or Net Banking.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I have exactly 500 rupees, why can't I spend it?”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Your bank might have a minimum balance requirement that cannot be withdrawn. Try a smaller amount.”

description: The transaction failed because the user entered the wrong Personal Identification Number (PIN).
system_behavior: The PIN block sent in the transaction message did not match the PIN stored in the Issuer's security module (HSM).
agent_message: “The PIN entered is incorrect. Please retry with the correct PIN. Note that 3 consecutive wrong attempts will block your card.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I entered the right PIN, but it failed.”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “It is possible there was a typing error. Please try again carefully. Do not guess if you are unsure.”
“Yes, but be careful. If you enter the wrong PIN 3 times in a row, the card will be blocked for 24 hours.”

description: The transaction failed because the physical RuPay card has passed its expiry date.
system_behavior: The 'Expiry Date' field in the transaction message is earlier than the current system date.
agent_message: “Your RuPay card has expired. Please contact your bank branch to get a new card issued.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “My card looks fine, why did it fail?”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Please check the 'Valid Thru' date printed on the front of your card. If that date has passed, the card is no longer active.”

description: The transaction amount is higher than the single-transaction limit set for this card variant.
system_behavior: The requested amount exceeds the velocity limit parameter configured for this specific card product (e.g., Classic vs Platinum).
agent_message: “The amount requested exceeds the limit allowed for your card type. Please try a smaller amount.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I am trying to buy a TV for ₹50,000.”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Your card might have a per-transaction limit (e.g., ₹25,000). You may need to split the payment or upgrade your card.”

description: The transaction failed because the Issuer Bank's system is down or not responding.
system_behavior: The RuPay network could not get a response from the Issuer Bank within the timeout period.
agent_message: “Your bank’s system is temporarily unavailable. Please try the transaction again later.”

user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “This means your bank's server is offline right now. It is a temporary technical issue.”

description: The transaction was attempted on a card that has been reported as lost or stolen.
system_behavior: The Issuer Bank's database flags this card number as 'Hotlisted'. The system declines the transaction and may send a 'Capture Card' instruction.
agent_message: “This transaction is declined because the card is reported as lost. Please contact your bank immediately.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I found my old card and tried to use it.”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Once a card is reported lost, it is permanently blocked for security. You must use the new card sent by the bank.”

description: The specific type of transaction is not allowed for this card (e.g., International usage on a domestic card).
system_behavior: The card is valid, but the 'Transaction Code' (e.g., International POS) is restricted by the Issuer's card parameters.
agent_message: “This transaction type is not supported or enabled for your card. Please check your card settings.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I am in London and my RuPay card isn't working.”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Unless you have a RuPay Global card with International usage enabled, it will only work within India.”
“You may need to enable 'E-commerce' transactions via your Mobile Banking app.”

description: The Issuer Bank declined the transaction without sharing a specific reason.
system_behavior: A catch-all decline code used when the bank refuses the transaction due to internal policies or unclassified risk checks.
agent_message: “The transaction was declined by your bank. Please contact your branch for more details.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “My card is new and has money, why 'Do Not Honor'?”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “This is a general decline from the bank. It could be due to a security flag or a temporary restriction on the card.”

description: The bank's risk monitoring system flagged the transaction as suspicious.
system_behavior: The Fraud Monitoring System (FMS) triggered a rule (e.g., unusual location, high velocity) and blocked the transaction.
agent_message: “The transaction was declined for security reasons. Please call your bank to verify your identity.”

user_scenarios.User Statement (Intent): “I am buying jewelry and it failed.”
user_scenarios.Suggested Agent Response: “Large, unusual transactions often trigger security blocks. You may receive a call from the bank to verify it's you.”
